abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment for the
            Chhattisgarh District Rural Poverty Project comprises both
            the environmental management framework, and the report on
            public consultations, and examines how the project might
            affect human resource, and stocks of natural resources, to
            then identify mitigation measures that minimize the negative
            environmental impacts of the project. Through a screening
            process, four categories of subprojects will be identified,
            suggesting the appropriate environmental mitigation.
            Overall, mitigation stipulates the following: to control
            soil erosion, protective barriers will be installed,
            including gravel exposure, while laboratory tests will be
            conducted to identify the presence of toxic chemicals, to
            prevent soil pollution; groundwater depletion will be
            controlled through the installation of bore wells, allowing
            the measurement of water levels, and, laboratory analysis
            will be conducted to prevent water pollution, and control
            bacteria that may affect health, while water logging will be
            surveyed; deforestation, and loss of biodiversity,
            particularly medicinal plants, will be surveyed, in order to
            be re-planted following project implementation. Construction
            designs will determine adequate spillways, and downstream
            slopes to prevent soil erosion, as well as dam safety
            measures, which will be supervised by qualified engineers.
